title: Found something some of you might be able to appreciate

replies.body: tbh Top Lane goes through 3 stages. 1. Two champions on a See-saw (anything can happen), 2. A Pillow Fight (both top laners still wanting to fight, but their lack of damage and amount of resistances makes things slow), 3. Farmville (both top laners respect each other's resistances and now value minions over brawling - out side of teamfights, PvE is the name of the game).
It's hard when you play a non-tank champ top lane... Unless the enemy laner is {{champion:86}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:54}}, they all seem to do lame damage early game even to non-tanks
Clearly there seems to be some confusion as to what I was referring to. It's actually got nothing to do with League of Legends, but rather Harvest Moon (specifically Back to Nature).
Obviously
Hahahaaa awesome
I cant appreciate that at all, top lane {{champion:107}} loves to fight :D
{{champion:107}}  is in the jungle.
I said top lane Rengar, not jungle.

The few games I played top to try a non meta pick, where the main part of it is the fact top lane is simply farming, so late-game scaling champs can try it out.

I get Darius, Rumble and Irelia in all 3 of the times I tried, all of them have no clue how to top and push lane to tower, and jg doesn't gank. FML.
That's why you play ADC's toplane, you automatically win as most toplanes aren't used to fighting.
Used to play Jinx top until someone picked Malph and I suddenly realized how screwed I was if they figured I was top and grabbed a solid counter like that. (No pun intended).

u wot m8.

Every time I play top lane it's nothing but trades. Trades for days.

\*whoosh*

That's the sound of the reference going over your head.

>
> \*whoosh*
> 
> That's the sound of the reference going over your head.

The reference was shit, therefore I didn't care to understand it. Do take your plebeian references and take them elsewhere.
Haha I remember the days of Top lane farm simulator. Good times.

No one gets it.

Why am I not surprised?
I get it, that's all that matters.
Do you really?
what kind of darius farms against a nasus instead of completely shitting on him.
